intro: Mesoclastes, commonly known as the desert sunflower, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single bloom. The plant has a robust root system that allows it to thrive in sandy, well-drained soils. Its leaves are typically narrow and covered in a waxy cuticle to reduce water loss. Mesoclastes produces vibrant yellow flowers that bloom in the morning and close by midday, adapting to the intense desert heat.
